Package student

Class Mob

java.lang.Object
student.Mob
public class Mob extends Object
A hostile Minecraft mob.
Author:
Ellen Spertus, Bryan Guen

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Tests whether this mob is equal to the passed object. This is only the case if the argument is a Mob constructed with all the same arguments and has taken the same amount of damage.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - the other object
      Returns:

    • isInjured

      public boolean isInjured()
      Checks whether this mob has taken any damage. Note that this returns true for mobs that are dead.
      Returns:
      true if the mob has taken damage, false if it is at maximum health

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether this mob is alive.
      Returns:
      true if the current health level is positive, false if it is zero.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Applies the specified number of points of damage to this mob (never letting the health level go below zero).
      Parameters:
      damage - the number of points of damage

    • getCurrentStrength

      public int getCurrentStrength()
      Gets the current strength of attacks by this mob. The strength is determined by scaling the maximum strength by the ratio of the current health points to the maximum health points, rounded up.

      For example, if a mob has a maximum strength of 15 and its current health level is half its maximum, its attack strength would be 8 (.5 * 15, rounded up).

      Returns:
      this mob's current attack strength

    • attack

      public String attack(Mob mob)
      Simulates an attack by this mob onto another mob, generating an appropriate message and possibly decrementing the other mob's health points.
      Parameters:
      mob - the mob that is being attacked
      Returns:
      a string describing the outcome

    • narrateBattle

      public static void narrateBattle(Mob mob1, Mob mob2)
      Simulates a battle to the death between two mobs, printing the result of each attack.
      Parameters:
      mob1 - the first mob
      mob2 - the second mob

    • main

      public static void main(String[] ignored)
      Simulates a battle between a skeleton and a zombie.
      Parameters:
      ignored - the command-line arguments
